intro: Anthocleista oubanguiensis, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
